channel.title: Problem with adding whonix repository
channel.description:
When i try to add whonix repository inside another debian based distro i get this error...
Warning: apt-key is deprecated. Manage keyring files in trusted.gpg.d instead (see apt-key(8)).

item.title: Problem with adding whonix repository
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
tor+ requires apt-transport-tor as documented + functional Tor.

If you want this, make tor+ work for any other non-Whonix repository fist. →

Whonix – 9 Aug 21

Information Booster might be Available!

Utilizing other resources to help solve questions/issues unspecific to Whonix ™.

Otherwise, drop tor+.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with adding whonix repository
item.dc:creator: anonimac
item.description:
Now i have this problem…

I have connected another VM to whonix gateaway, did everything from this tutorial…

“Whonix ™ Packages for Debian Hosts and Whonix ™ Host Enhancements)”

but simply can’t get whonix repository to work, after apt-get update i get this error

Err:9 tor+https://deb.whonix.org bullseye InRelease
Timed out while waiting to read ‘first part of response’ from proxy socks5h://127.0.0.1:9050 [IP: 127.0.0.1 9050]
W: Failed to fetch tor+https://deb.whonix.org/dists/bullseye/InRelease Timed out while waiting to read ‘first part of response’ from proxy socks5h://127.0.0.1:9050 [IP: 127.0.0.1 9050]
W: Some index files failed to download. They have been ignored, or old ones used instead.

What am i doing wrong?

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with adding whonix repository
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Support Request Policy

apt-key Deprecation / Apt 2.2 changes Development
Interesting changes: apt-key and trusted.gpg are slated for deprecation. Users should move on to trusted.gpg.d instead. Our guides need to be updated to reflect that. @torjunkie please feel free to look at it when you have time. There’s discussion about moving from GPG entirely for apt… New features Various patterns related to dependencies, such as ?depends are now available (2.1.16) The Protected field is now supported. It replaces the previous Important field and is like Essential, …

Read full topic
